abstract: Entertainment mogul David Geffen donates $100 million for expansion and renovation of Museum of Modern Art, while Metropolitan Museum of Art, trying to compete, struggles with $10 million deficit, possible staff layoffs and delay over planning of new wing for Modern and contemporary art; diverging fortunes of museums highlight larger trend in which Modern and contemporary art dominates art world.

headline.print_headline: 2 Art Worlds:  Flush MoMA,  Struggling Met
headline.main: 2 Art Worlds: Flush MoMA, Struggling Met

snippet: The diverging fortunes of the New York City museums illustrate the current state of the art community, which is dominated by Modern and contemporary art.
lead_paragraph: The diverging fortunes of the New York City museums illustrate the current state of the art community, which is dominated by Modern and contemporary art.
